content: It's a metaphor for how people experience trauma and then use it as an explanation for their current suffering. "I was abused by Mom" or "my Dad was never there". etc. That really sucks and it is a genuine life disadvantage to experience that, but emotionally it doesn't matter at all what actually occurred to you, as many people have no effect from the same trauma, the actual *real* effect is what your current beliefs about yourself are that exist in your brain right now. I met some people in university who had traumatic breakdowns because they got B's in chemistry class and thought they were lifelong failures, while my entire highschool experience at a more disadvantaged catchment public school was one where being "academic" was the equivalent of being "cringe" and tryhard. A person from each of these environments are not actually affected by their experiences, but their present beliefs about themselves that are incorreclty shaped by an intellectual model of their past experiences.
